title: Diamond operator
summary: Diamond operator now works with anonymous classes too.
explanation: Java 7 introduced <> but it didn't work with anonymous inner classes. Java 9 fixed this, so you never need to repeat type arguments on the right-hand side.

whyModernWins.title: Consistent rules
whyModernWins.desc: Diamond works everywhere ‚Äî constructors and anonymous classes alike.

whyModernWins.title: Less redundancy
whyModernWins.desc: Type arguments are stated once on the left, never repeated.

whyModernWins.title: DRY principle
whyModernWins.desc: The compiler already knows the type ‚Äî why write it twice?

support: Diamond with anonymous classes since JDK 9 (Sept 2017).
